intro: Oreinotinus villosus, commonly known as the hairy orchid, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive hairy leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow with a subtle fragrance, attracting specific pollinators. Due to habitat loss, Oreinotinus villosus is considered a rare and threatened species.
